summary: Salesforce reported strong financial performance in Q1 of fiscal 2024, with revenue reaching $8.2 billion, representing an 11% year-over-year increase. The company achieved a non-GAAP operating margin of 27.6%, driven by disciplined investment strategies and restructuring efforts. Operationally, Salesforce has made significant strides in enhancing productivity and operational excellence, which contributed to improved profitability. The company is focused on a transformation plan that prioritizes resource optimization, product investment, and operational rigor. Strategic initiatives, particularly in AI with Data Cloud and Einstein GPT, position Salesforce as a leader in the evolving market. Looking ahead, the company has raised its guidance for profitability and cash flow, indicating confidence in sustained growth despite some market challenges.
key_highlights: Q1 revenue of $8.2 billion, up 11% year-over-year.
Non-GAAP operating margin of 27.6%, reflecting strong cost management.
Operating cash flow increased by 22% year-over-year to $4.5 billion.
Successful completion of restructuring efforts announced in January.
Focus on AI innovations positions Salesforce as a market leader.

metrics.description: Total revenue for Q1 fiscal year 2024, representing an 11% increase year-over-year.
CRPO for Q1 fiscal year 2024, indicating future revenue under contract, up 12% year-over-year.
Total RPO at the end of Q1 fiscal year 2024, reflecting all future revenue under contract.
Non-GAAP operating margin for Q1 fiscal year 2024, showing a significant increase of 1000 basis points year-over-year.
Operating cash flow for Q1 fiscal year 2024, representing a 22% increase year-over-year.
Free cash flow for Q1 fiscal year 2024, up 21% year-over-year.
Expected GAAP earnings per share for Q2 fiscal year 2024.
Expected non-GAAP earnings per share for Q2 fiscal year 2024.
